appearances on the margins of the British tabloid culture. But just one month after Pop Idol premiered in 2001, the tabloid Sunday People zeroed in on Simon Cowell under the headline WOMEN FANS FALL FOR MR. NASTY. The record boss is being chased by besotted women wanting to get to know him better-despite his sarcastic comments and cutting remarks to young wannabes on the hit ITV talent show. As his public profile rose, Simon Cowell took action to manage his image. Over 40 when Pop Idol began, Simon Cowell had had a handful of semipublic romances with singers and model types. However, his

early fan favorite teen David Archuleta had outperformed his rival. ''You came out here tonight to win, and what we have witnessed is a knockout,'' said prickly judge Simon Cowell . Judge Randy Jackson concurred, proclaiming the best singer of season 7 is right there, following David Archuleta 's rendition of John Lennon 's ''Imagine,'' a song that earlier in the competition had brought him some of his best feedback.
